metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 10 axioms covering composite entities, their components and relations, figure-ground relations, and patterns
metadata.notation: First-order logic with composite entity structures and figure-ground relations

axioms.title: Definition of componentOrWhole
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x) (iff (componentOrWhole x1 x) (or (equal x1 x)(componentOf x1 x))))
axioms.english: componentOrWhole is the disjunction of componentOf and being equal to the whole

axioms.title: Definition of externalTo
axioms.fol: (forall (y x) (iff (externalTo y x) (not (exists (y1 x1) (and (componentOrWhole y1 y) (componentOrWhole x1 x) (equal y1 x1))))))
axioms.english: An entity y is external to a composite entity x if neither it nor any of its components is equal to x or one of x's components

axioms.title: Definition of onlyarg*
axioms.fol: (forall (y e) (iff (onlyarg* y e) (and (eventuality e)(nequal y e) (forall (y1) (if (arg y1 e) (or (equal y1 y) (onlyarg* y y1)))))))
axioms.english: y is the only arg* of e, after recursing through all the eventuality arguments

axioms.title: Properties set constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (s2 x) (if (propertiesOf s2 x) (and (set s2)(compositeEntity x) (forall (e) (if (member e s2) (exists (y) (and (componentOrWhole y x) (onlyarg* y e))))))))
axioms.english: All the elements in the properties of a composite entity have an onlyarg* that is either a component of the composite entity or the whole

axioms.title: Relations set constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (s3 x) (if (relationsOf s3 x) (and (set s3)(compositeEntity x) (forall (e) (if (member e s3) (exists (y z) (and (componentOrWhole y x)(arg* y e) (nequal z y)(arg* z e))))))))
axioms.english: The set of relations of a composite entity are relations between a component or the whole, and something else

axioms.title: Definition of single relation
axioms.fol: (forall (e x) (iff (relationOf e x) (exists (s) (and (relationsOf s x)(member e s)))))
axioms.english: A relation is a relation of a composite entity if it is in the relationsOf set

axioms.title: Definition of propOrRelOf
axioms.fol: (forall (e x) (iff (propOrRelOf e x) (exists (s) (and (member e s) (or (propertiesOf s x)(relationsOf s x))))))
axioms.english: Something is a property or a relation of a composite entity if it's in either the properties or relations set

axioms.title: Set as composite entity
axioms.fol: (forall (e s s1 s2 s3) (if (and (set' e s)(Rexist e)(not (null s)) (singleton s2 e)(null s3)) (and (compositeEntity s)(componentsOf s s) (propertiesOf s2 s)(relationsOf s3 s))))
axioms.english: A set is a composite entity where its components are its members, its only property is that it is a set, and there are no relations

axioms.title: Pair as composite entity
axioms.fol: (forall (p x y e1 e2 e3) (if (and (pair0' e1 p)(first' e2 x p)(second' e3 y p) (Rexist e1)(Rexist e2)(Rexist e3)) (exists (s1 s2 s3) (and (compositeEntity p) (doubleton s1 x y)(componentsOf s1 p) (singleton s2 e1)(propertiesOf s2 p) (doubleton s3 e2 e3)(relationsOf s3 p)))))
axioms.english: Ordered pairs can be viewed as composite entities, where the components are the first and second elements, with pair property and first/second relations

axioms.title: Sequence as composite entity
axioms.fol: (forall (e s) (if (and (sequence' e s)(Rexist e) (exists (x)(inSeq x s))) (exists (s1 s2 s3) (and (compositeEntity s) (forall (x)(iff (member x s1)(inSeq x s))) (componentsOf s1 s) (singleton s2 e)(propertiesOf s2 s) (forall (e1) (iff (member e1 s3) (exists (x y) (and (beforeInSeq' e1 x y s) (Rexist e1))))) (relationsOf s3 s)))))
axioms.english: A sequence can be viewed as a composite entity, whose components are the elements of the sequence and whose relations are the ordering relations

axioms.title: Figure-ground constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s) (if (at x y s)(and (componentOf y s)(externalTo x s))))
axioms.english: If x is at y in s, then y must be a component of s and x must be external to s

axioms.title: Definition of ground (first form)
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (ground s) (and (compositeEntity s) (exists (e y) (and (arg* y e) (forall (y1) (if (componentOf y1 s) (exists (e1) (and (subst y e y1 e1) (if (Rexist s) (Rexist e1))))))))))))
axioms.english: Something is a potential ground if it is a composite entity and there is some property type e that holds when its parameter y is instantiated with any component y1 of s

axioms.title: Definition of ground (second form)
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (ground s) (and (compositeEntity s) (exists (e y s1) (and (componentsOf s1 s)(typelt y s1)(arg* y e) (if (Rexist s)(Rexist e)))))))
axioms.english: Alternative definition of ground using typical elements: there is some property e that all the components share

axioms.title: At relation requires ground
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s)(if (at x y s)(ground s)))
axioms.english: The third argument of an at relation must be a ground

axioms.title: Definition of pattern
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (iff (pattern x) (exists (y s1) (and (componentOf y x)(typelt y s1)))))
axioms.english: A pattern is a composite entity that contains type elements among its components

axioms.title: Definition of pattern parameters
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (if (pattern x) (iff (patternParameters s x) (forall (y) (iff (member y s) (exists (s1) (and (componentOf y x)(typelt y s1))))))))
axioms.english: The parameters of a pattern are the components that are type elements

axioms.title: Definition of pattern instance
axioms.fol: (forall (x x1 s) (if (and (pattern x)(patternParameters s x)) (iff (patternInstance x1 x) (forall (y s1) (if (and (member y s)(typelt y s1)) (exists (y1) (and (member y1 s1)(componentOf y1 x1) (forall (p) (if (and (propOrRelOf p x)(arg* y p)) (exists (p1) (and (subst y1 p1 y p) (propOrRelOf p1 x1)))))))))))))
axioms.english: An instance of a pattern is a composite entity in which all parameters have been replaced by entities that are members of the set the parameter is the type element of

axioms.title: Definition of incomplete instance
axioms.fol: (forall (x x1 s) (if (and (pattern x)(patternParameters s x)) (iff (incompleteInstance x1 x) (and (exists (y y1 s1 p p1) (and (member y s)(typelt y s1) (componentOf y1 x1)(member y1 s1) (propOrRelOf p x)(arg* y p) (subst y1 p1 y p)(propOrRelOf p1 x1))) (exists (p y) (and (propOrRelOf p x)(arg* y p) (forall (y1 p1) (if (subst y1 p1 y p) (not (propOrRelOf p1 x1))))))))))
axioms.english: An incomplete instance is a composite entity in which at least one parameter is instantiated and some but not all of the properties and relations are instantiated

conversion_notes.composite_structure: This chapter provides the foundation for understanding complex entities with components, properties, and relations
conversion_notes.figure_ground_relation: The 'at' relation captures the fundamental figure-ground relationship from cognitive science
conversion_notes.pattern_system: Patterns with type elements enable template-based reasoning and instantiation
conversion_notes.examples: Axioms 10.12-10.14 show how basic structures (sets, pairs, sequences) are composite entities
conversion_notes.two_ground_definitions: Axioms 10.16-10.17 provide equivalent definitions of 'ground' using different approaches
conversion_notes.recursive_definitions: Several predicates (onlyarg*, pattern instances) use recursive definitions

file_format_notes.completeness: All axioms from Chapter 10 extracted and converted
file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
file_format_notes.foundation: Provides structural foundation for understanding complex entities and their relationships

title: Definition of composite entity
fol: (forall (x) (iff (compositeEntity x) (exists (s1 s2 s3) (and (componentsOf s1 x)(propertiesOf s2 x) (relationsOf s3 x)))))
english: A composite entity is characterized by a set of components, a set of properties, and a set of relations

domain.title: Components set constraints
domain.fol: (forall (s1 x) (if (componentsOf s1 x) (and (set s1)(compositeEntity x)(not (null s1)))))
domain.english: The set of components of a composite entity is nonempty

domain.title: Definition of single component
domain.fol: (forall (y x) (iff (componentOf y x) (and (compositeEntity x) (exists (s) (and (componentsOf s x)(member y s))))))
domain.english: A component of a composite entity is one of the components in the components set

domain.title: Definition of aggregate
domain.fol: (forall (x y z) (iff (aggregate x y z) (and (compositeEntity x) (exists (s) (and (componentsOf s x)(doubleton s y z))))))
domain.english: An aggregate of two entities is a composite entity with those two entities as its components
